title: Reduced Tillage Systems for Organic Vegetable Production

tasks.task: Conducting a research update on reduced tillage systems in organic vegetable production
subtasks: Introducing the purpose and goals of the research
Acknowledging funding sources (Ceres Trust and North Central SARE)
Describing cover crop selection (rye and vetch) and seeding rates
Explain the timing and process of cover crop termination (rolling with a roller crimper)
Detailing the experimental design (no-till, strip-till, conventional till treatments with two nitrogen fertilization strategies)
Monitoring outcomes such as yield and nitrate leaching (using lysimeters)
Discussing the techniques used for strip-till during the growing season

tasks.task: Operation of equipment for strip-till in no-till and strip-till systems
subtasks: Describing the setup and components of the strip tiller (row cleaners, coulter, subsoil shank, rolling disc, side dressing unit, rolling basket)
Explaining the process of using the strip tiller in fall and pre-planting to manage cover crops and apply fertilizer
Addressing challenges (like fixing the subsoil shank's rolling disc) encountered during strip till operations

tasks.task: Components and operation of a roller crimper
subtasks: Identification and functionality of the roller crimper (8-foot INJ model by Rodale Institute)
Demonstration of how the blades crimp cover crops and the impact of adding water for better kill
Illustrating the process of terminating cover crops in the rows for no-till and strip-till plots
